page.title: 15DEVIZES CANOE RACE.
page.content: This race,which first took place in 1948,was started by four members of the Devizes Rover Scouts. It takes place annually at Easter,with the start early on Good Friday. The course of 125 miles along the Kennet and Avon Canal and the River Thames,is from Devizes Wharf to Westminster Bridge in London. The crews usually take three to four days to complete the course and many tourists gather in Devizes to watch the start. Competitors are faced with many miles of hazardous waterway,including a total of seventy-seven locks which they have to navigate. The race which has been described as one of the toughest events in the sporting calendar now attracts an entry of 200 crews including teams from abroad.
